text: Lee Cha-su (; also written as Lee Cha-soo, 6 June 1957 â€“ 9 March 2020) was a South Korean politician and social activist who called for the resettlement of the K-2 Air Force Base used at Daegu International Airport. He was the chairman of the Buk-gu Council. Lee died in Chilgok, Buk District, Daegu at the age of 62 due to coronavirus (COVID-19) on 9 March 2020.Chilgok region of Buk district is differ than Chilgok County == References == Category:1957 births Category:2020 deaths Category:South Korean politicians Category:South Korean activists Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic
title: Lee Cha-su
